contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Hongū'''|本宮町|Hongū-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Higashimuro District, Wakayama]], Japan. On May 1, 2005, Hongū, along with the village of [[Ryūjin, Wakayama|Ryūjin]], from [[Hidaka District, Wakayama|Hidaka District]], the town of [[Nakahechi, Wakayama|Nakahechi]], and the village of [[Ōtō, Wakayama|Ōtō]], both from [[Nishimuro District, Wakayama|Nishimuro District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Tanabe, Wakayama|Tanabe]]. In 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 3,759 and a [[population density]] of 18.42 persons per km². The total area was 204.06 km². ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.town.hongu.wakayama.jp}} {{ja icon}} {{Coord|33|50|17.3|N|135|46|23.2|E|type:city(3828)_region:JP-30|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hongu, Wakayama}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Wakayama Prefecture]] {{Wakayama-geo-stub}}
